greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square root of sum defined in A007475(n) and A001032(n).
comment: 6a(n)^2 is divisible by A001032(n). Proof: Let s = A007475(n), n = A001032(n), then a(n)^2 = sum(k=s, s+n-1, k^2) = n/6*(2n^2+(6s-3)n+6s^2-6s+1).
link: Christopher E. Thompson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10438
results.author: _Ralf Stephan_, Nov 03 2002
ext: Offset corrected to 1 (to match A001032) by _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 02 2016
